text: A bowl of Korean sea salt Korean sea salt crystals Korean brining salt, also called Korean sea salt, is a variety of edible salt with a larger grain size compared to common kitchen salt. It is called wang-sogeum (; "king/queen salt") or gulgeun-sogeum (; "coarse salt") in Korean. The salt is used mainly for salting napa cabbages when making kimchi. Being minimally processed, it serves to help developing flavours in fermented foods. == References == Category:Salts Category:Edible salt Category:Korean cuisine
title: Korean brining salt
